site_description: Would you like to find out how were books written in olden days?

guide_messages.stage_1_1: In the past, people wrote all books by hand on animal skin. These were called manuscripts. Let’s make our own!
guide_messages.stage_1_2: We begin by preparing the page. Here is the entire skin stretched in front of you. Let’s scrape it a bit. Take the round knife and scrape all the dots out!
guide_messages.stage_1_3: Now, take a sharp straight knife, and cut the page as big as you like!
guide_messages.stage_1_4: What do you think is the best shape?
guide_messages.stage_1_5: It’s time to sprinkle some powder. This will make the ink stick to the page.
guide_messages.stage_1_6: Lines will help us keep the letters straight. Connect the dots to make lines.
guide_messages.stage_1_7: Your page is ready for writing! Here are some tools you can use: dip the feather in ink to write, if you make a mistake, use a knife (pen-knife!) like a rubber to erase it
